so this is resolution
1-22 it's a resolution to express
condolences upon the passing of stanley
b perkins senior and to further express
gratitude for his services to the
louisiana public service commission
to express the condolences of the
commission upon the passing of
commission employee stanley perkins
senior and to further express gratitude
for his lifetime of service to the
commission and the people of the state
of louisiana whereas the members of the
louisiana public service commission and
its staff were saddened to learn of the
passing of stanley b stan perkins senior
on september 9th of 2022 and whereas
stan was a graduate of xavier university
in new orleans where i stand prior to
his tenure with the commission began his
public service career serving in the
united states army and where i stand on
november 23 1992 was hired by the
commission as a staff auditor and
ultimately became audit manager director
in 1998 he served in that position to
his retirement from the commission on
march 15 2014 leading to the
commission's audit division leading the
commission's audit division for 17 years
and where i stand during his tenure with
the audit division represented the
commission in hundreds of cases and
mentored and trained numerous auditors
utility specialists economists and
attorneys in utility regulation and
whereas stan as a speaker and
representative of the commission was
always smiling and welcoming at numerous
conferences and forums throughout his
tenure
and whereas stan following his
retirement was shortly thereafter called
to return to his public service
rejoining the commission only three
months later on june 14th of 2014 to
serve the people of district 3 as an
enforcement agent
but a position he continued to serve
until his passing killmoney nearly 30
years of public service with the
commission
now therefore be it resolved that the
louisiana public service commission does
hereby express its deepest sympathies
and sincere condolences to the family of
stanley b stan perkins senior and does
hereby offer best wishes hopes and
prayers for comfort to those who mourn
his passing
be it further resolved that the
louisiana public service commission does
hereby express its deepest gratitude to
the family of stan perkins for the gift
and lasting legacy of his service to the
commission and to the people of the
state of louisiana be it further
resolved that a suitable copy of this
resolution be transmitted to mr
perkins's
family thank you
so we will now move to exhibit number 22
which is docket number u u36190
this is entergy louisiana's application
for certification and approval of the
2021 solar portfolio rider go green
option cost recovery and related relief
it's a discussion impossible vote on an
uncontested stipulated settlement at the
request of chairman bossier on november
9th of 2021 entergy filed its
application for approval of the 21 solar
portfolio go green option cost recovery
and related relief notice that the
application was published in the
commissions of bulletin official
bulletin and the alliance league and
walmart timely intervened on november
30th of 2021 elect filed its petition
for late intervention and the tribute
tribunal issued notice giving parties an
opportunity to comment with a deadline
and no comments were received during
that period the tribunal therefore
granted a lex petition
after discovery and the filing of
testimony energy and commission staff
filed a joint motion for the scheduling
of a hearing of an uncontested
stipulated settlement term sheet on
august 29th of 2022 the motion was
accompanied by the term sheet and
supporting exhibits and testimony the
settlement term sheet describes the four
solar photovoltaic resources with a
total nameplate capacity of 475
megawatts that compromise the entergy
2021 solar portfolio three of the
selected resources will not be owned by
energy and are subject to purchase power
agreements while one will be owned by
entergy and is subject to a bill to own
transfer contract
the settlement term sheet also
establishes a series of reporting
requirements to allow the commission to
monitor the construction status of the
four resources to review the final cost
prior to setting any initial rates and
to monitor and revise the rates subject
to the conditions set forth therein the
settlement term sheet also adopts a new
go green option tariff to allow
customers to participate in the risk the
cost the benefits and the environmental
attributes of the four resources through
subscriptions and subscription fees to
cover the cost of the resources offset
by the marcel market revenues
certain issues in this proceeding will
be resolved in a future rate filing
pursuant to the terms of the settlement
term sheet the uncontested stipulated
settlement resolves all other issues in
this docket as the resources
compromising the 21 solar portfolios
serve the public convenience and
necessity are in the public interest as
modified by the terms of the settlement
term sheet therefore staff recommends
that the commission accept the
uncontested stipulated settlement filed
into the record on august 29 2022
